revised_title: Investigation of Diatoms on the Skin of Whales
tldr: The author examines the skin of whales, particularly in Antarctic waters, and discovers a film of diatoms, a type of algae, on the whales' skin. The diatoms are found in large numbers and are also present on sea ice in the region. The author suggests that the whales may acquire this coating of diatoms from their food sources in the icy waters.
